greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of q * psi(-q) * psi(-q^7) in powers of q where psi(q) is a Ramanujan theta function.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) := Product_{k>=1} (1-(-q)^k) (see A121373), phi(q) := theta_3(q) := Sum_{k=-oo..oo} q^(k^2) (A000122), psi(q) := Sum_{k=0..oo} q^(k*(k+1)/2) (A010054), chi(q) := Product_{k>=0} (1+q^(2k+1)) (A000700).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of eta(q)*eta(q^4)*eta(q^7)*eta(q^28)/(eta(q^2)*eta(q^14)) in powers of q.
Multiplicative with a(2^e) = -1 if e>0, a(7^e) = 1, a(p^e) = e+1 if p == 1, 2, 4 (mod 7), a(p^e) = (1+(-1)^e)/2 if p == 3, 5, 6 (mod 7).
mathematica: eta[q_]:= q^(1/24)*QPochhammer[q]; Rest[CoefficientList[Series[eta[q] eta[q^4] eta[q^7] eta[q^28]/(eta[q^2] eta[q^14]), {q, 0, 100}], q]] (* _G. C. Greubel_, Apr 19 2018 *)
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Jul 30 2006
